TopicTitle: What little thing do YOU think should be added to KSP?

Articles.Content:
7 hours ago, Atlas2342 said:

1.25 SRB's?

All the SRBs are 1.25m.  Do you mean SRBs in other sizes?  Then I agree.  A 0.625m and 2.5m SRB option would be nice.
A count down in Kerbalees when you hit (Space) at the launch pad > 5 > 4 > 3 > 2 > 1 > We have Blast Off
additional SRB segments do increase duration/power
I think you should be able to rotate flags, and adjustable landing gear should be made stock.

Microbial life on Eve, and Laythe.

Edited March 6, 2016 by Spaceception

6 hours ago, zolotiyeruki said:

All the SRBs are 1.25m.  Do you mean SRBs in other sizes?  Then I agree.  A 0.625m and 2.5m SRB option would be nice.

Oops, I meant 0.625m SRBs
I would say a larger deployable flag in addition to the current one, one that's taller then the current one, so it fits in with something like a base on Duna.
Dual monitor support.

In addition to the "EVA" and "IVA" buttons in Kerbonauts' portraits, how about a "transfer" button? That way you can move a Kerbonaut without having to check every crew compartment on the ship because you forgot where the little (*&@#@&*(*^@ is hiding......

(This frequently gets to be an issue for me, because I run some big operations--my upcoming mission to Duna is flagged by a mothership that will be carrying a crew of 20)

Edited March 10, 2016 by GeneralVeers
Apparently one particular B-word is censored!

10 hours ago, GeneralVeers said:

In addition to the "EVA" and "IVA" buttons in Kerbonauts' portraits, how about a "transfer" button? That way you can move a Kerbonaut without having to check every crew compartment on the ship because you forgot where the little (*&@#@&*(*^@ is hiding......

Absolutely agree!  I'm running some Tourist contracts, where some of the tourists need to land on the Mun.  I have the rest of the touring crew sit in orbit while the surface-bound tourist does his/her thing, and it's a pain trying to figure out where I put each tourist.

Two things I actually thought of several times ever since I got KSP, but just remembered again today:

Two things needed in Map View: there needs to be a way to select the planet you're currently orbiting as the target, and also it needs to be possible to select "focus view" with Kerbin like you can with any other planet (Kerbin doesn't give you the "set target/focus view" menu in the map).

7 hours ago, Alpha188 said:

I am almost sure that you already can focus view on Kerbin: just double-click on it.

You can. I was already aware of this.

The reason this keeps becoming an issue for me is, much of the time I've got multiple ships in Kerbin orbit. Fact is, I can't get at Kerbin because the double-click keeps registering on one of the ships instead. With most other planets, you can single-click to get the focus option, but Kerbin thinks it's special and gives you an attitude about it.

Side note: clicking on stuff seems to be squirrelly in a couple other ways, such as when a ship icon is visible but clicking on it doesn't give you the "target" option. I think it's because the planet that ship is orbiting doesn't "have the focus" but the game doesn't make clear why.
It would be nice if I could get the brakes to stay-on without having to time wrap with the B-key held down. Seeing as you can't activate airbrakes get get them to hold once your in the atmosphere.
